text: 法国的首都是巴黎，它以埃菲尔铁塔和卢浮宫博物馆而闻名。
日本的首都是东京。东京是世界上人口最多的都会区之一。
中国的首都是北京，拥有故宫、长城等著名历史遗迹。
美国的首都华盛顿特区，是白宫和国会大厦的所在地。
英国的首都是伦敦，泰晤士河穿城而过，大本钟是其标志。
Canberra is the capital city of Australia.
Ottawa is the capital of Canada, located in Ontario.
Brasilia is the federal capital of Brazil and seat of government.
Moscow is the capital and largest city of Russia.
New Delhi is the capital of India and an administrative district of NCT Delhi.
埃及的首都是开罗，尼罗河三角洲的顶端，金字塔就在附近。
柏林是德国的首都，也是德国最大的城市。
罗马是意大利的首都，曾是古罗马帝国的中心。
马德里是西班牙的首都及最大城市。
Bangkok is the capital and most populous city of Thailand.
Seoul is the capital and largest metropolis of South Korea.
Hanoi is the capital city of Vietnam.
Buenos Aires is the capital and largest city of Argentina.
Mexico City is the capital and largest city of Mexico.
Cape Town is one of the three capital cities of South Africa.
光合作用是植物利用阳光、水和二氧化碳产生氧气和葡萄糖的过程。
牛顿第一运动定律指出，除非受到外力作用，否则物体将保持静止或匀速直线运动。
DNA（脱氧核糖核酸）是生物体发育和正常运作必不可少的生物大分子。
The Big Bang theory is the prevailing cosmological model for the universe from the earliest known periods.
Evolution is the change in the heritable characteristics of biological populations over successive generations.
原子是构成普通物质的最小单位，由质子、中子和电子组成。
水循环是指水在地球表面、大气和地下之间连续运动的过程。
Gravity is a natural phenomenon by which all things with mass or energy are brought toward one another.
Black holes are regions of spacetime where gravity is so strong that nothing can escape from it.
The periodic table is a tabular display of the chemical elements.
细胞是生物体结构和功能的基本单位。
爱因斯坦提出了相对论，彻底改变了我们对时间、空间和引力的理解。
Mitochondria are known as the powerhouses of the cell.
The speed of light in vacuum is approximately 299,792,458 meters per second.
Plate tectonics is a scientific theory describing the large-scale motion of seven large plates of Earth's lithosphere.
量子力学是描述微观物质（如原子和亚原子粒子）行为的物理学理论。
热力学第一定律是能量守恒定律在热现象领域的推广。
Antibiotics are medicines that fight bacterial infections in people and animals.
Vaccines train the immune system to recognize and combat pathogens.
Climate change refers to long-term shifts in temperatures and weather patterns.
Python是一种广泛使用的高级编程语言，以其清晰的语法和代码可读性而闻名。
JavaScript是Web开发的三大核心技术之一，主要用于浏览器端的脚本编写。
Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines.
Blockchain is a distributed ledger technology that maintains a growing list of records, called blocks.
Linux是一种自由和开放源代码的类Unix操作系统。
Docker是一个开源的应用容器引擎，让开发者可以打包他们的应用以及依赖包到一个可移植的容器中。
Kubernetes is an open-source container orchestration system for automating software deployment, scaling, and management.
React is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on components.
Vue.js是一个用于构建用户界面的渐进式JavaScript框架。
Git是一个免费的开源分布式版本控制系统。
SQL (Structured Query Language) is a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system.
HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is an application layer protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems.
云计算通过互联网提供服务器、存储、数据库、网络、软件等计算服务。
5G是第五代移动通信技术，具有高速度、低时延和大连接的特点。
Machine Learning is a field of inquiry devoted to understanding and building methods that 'learn'.
Rust is a multi-paradigm, general-purpose programming language that emphasizes performance, type safety, and concurrency.
TypeScript是JavaScript的超集，添加了可选的静态类型。
Node.js is a cross-platform, open-source server environment that can run JavaScript code outside a web browser.
Virtual Reality (VR) is a simulated experience that can be similar to or completely different from the real world.
物联网（IoT）是指通过互联网连接的物理设备网络，这些设备可以收集和共享数据。
第二次世界大战于1939年爆发，1945年结束，是人类历史上规模最大的全球性冲突。
秦始皇是中国历史上第一位皇帝，他统一了六国，建立了秦朝。
The Industrial Revolution was the transition to new manufacturing processes in Great Britain, continental Europe, and the United States.
The Renaissance was a fervent period of European cultural, artistic, political and economic 'rebirth' following the Middle Ages.
唐朝是中国历史上最强盛的朝代之一，以其开放的文化和繁荣的经济著称。
古埃及文明以金字塔、木乃伊和象形文字闻名于世。
Alexander the Great was a king of the ancient Greek kingdom of Macedon.
Julius Caesar was a Roman general and statesman who played a critical role in the events that led to the demise of the Roman Republic and the rise of the Roman Empire.
法国大革命是1789年爆发的一场深刻的政治和社会革命。
美国南北战争（1861-1865）是美国历史上关于奴隶制和国家统一的内战。
The Cold War was a period of geopolitical tension between the United States and the Soviet Union and their respective allies.
Apollo 11 was the spaceflight that first landed humans on the Moon.
成吉思汗是蒙古帝国的奠基者，他统一了蒙古各部。
孔子是中国古代著名的思想家、教育家，儒家学派的创始人。
Christopher Columbus was an Italian explorer and navigator who completed four voyages across the Atlantic Ocean.
Leonardo da Vinci was an Italian polymath of the High Renaissance who is active as a painter, draughtsman, engineer, scientist, theorist, sculptor, and architect.
明治维新是日本在19世纪后半叶进行的一场政治、经济和社会改革，使其迅速现代化。
The Berlin Wall was a guarded concrete barrier that physically and ideologically divided Berlin from 1961 to 1989.
Mahatma Gandhi was an Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist and political ethicist.
丝绸之路是连接中国和西方的重要贸易路线。
William Shakespeare was an English playwright, poet, and actor, widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language.
《红楼梦》是中国古典四大名著之一，作者是曹雪芹。
《西游记》讲述了唐僧师徒四人去西天取经的故事。
Harry Potter is a series of seven fantasy novels written by British author J. K. Rowling.
The Lord of the Rings is an epic high-fantasy novel by English author and scholar J. R. R. Tolkien.
李白是唐代伟大的浪漫主义诗人，被后人誉为“诗仙”。
杜甫是唐代伟大的现实主义诗人，被后人誉为“诗圣”。
To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel by the American author Harper Lee.
1984 is a dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale by the English writer George Orwell.
《三国演义》描写了东汉末年到西晋初年之间近百年的历史风云。
Hamlet is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare.
Pride and Prejudice is an 1813 novel of manners by Jane Austen.
《水浒传》是中国历史上第一部用白话文写成的章回小说。
Don Quixote is a Spanish novel by Miguel de Cervantes.
鲁迅是中国现代文学的奠基人之一，代表作有《狂人日记》、《阿Q正传》。
The Great Gatsby is a 1925 novel by American writer F. Scott Fitzgerald.
《百年孤独》是哥伦比亚作家加西亚·马尔克斯的代表作，魔幻现实主义文学的经典。
Sherlock Holmes is a fictional private detective created by British author Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.
海明威是美国著名作家，代表作有《老人与海》。
Les Misérables is a French historical novel by Victor Hugo.
Vincent van Gogh was a Dutch Post-Impressionist painter who is among the most famous and influential figures in the history of Western art.
Pablo Picasso was a Spanish painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist and theatre designer.
《蒙娜丽莎》是列奥纳多·达·芬奇创作的油画，现藏于卢浮宫。
Impressionism is a 19th-century art movement characterized by relatively small, thin, yet visible brush strokes.
Michelangelo was an Italian sculptor, painter, architect and poet of the High Renaissance.
《清明上河图》是北宋画家张择端的风俗画作品。
Beethoven was a German composer and pianist.
Mozart was a prolific and influential composer of the Classical period.
京剧是中国影响最大的戏曲剧种。
The Starry Night is an oil on canvas painting by Dutch Post-Impressionist painter Vincent van Gogh.
Football (Soccer) is a team sport played with a spherical ball between two teams of 11 players.
Basketball is a team sport in which two teams, most commonly of five players each, opposing one another on a rectangular court.
The Olympic Games are leading international sporting events featuring summer and winter sports competitions.
迈克尔·乔丹被广泛认为是有史以来最伟大的篮球运动员。
Lionel Messi is an Argentine professional footballer.
乒乓球是中国的国球。
Tennis is a racket sport that can be played individually against a single opponent or between two teams of two players each.
Usain Bolt is a Jamaican retired sprinter, widely considered to be the greatest sprinter of all time.
Cricket is a bat-and-ball game played between two teams of eleven players.
Super Bowl is the annual league championship game of the National Football League (NFL) of the United States.
Sushi is a traditional Japanese dish of prepared vinegared rice.
Pizza is a dish of Italian origin consisting of a usually round, flat base of leavened wheat-based dough topped with tomatoes, cheese, and often various other ingredients.
饺子是中国北方的传统食物，通常在春节食用。
Chocolate is a food made from roasted and ground cacao seeds.
Coffee is a brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans.
Tea is an aromatic beverage prepared by pouring hot or boiling water over cured or fresh leaves of Camellia sinensis.
火锅是一种中国烹饪方法，在餐桌上放一个煮着汤底的锅，食客自己涮煮食物。
Pasta is a type of food typically made from an unleavened dough of wheat flour mixed with water or eggs.
Kimchi is a traditional Korean side dish of salted and fermented vegetables.
Tacos are a traditional Mexican dish consisting of a small hand-sized corn or wheat tortilla topped with a filling.
